Detailed Description

Functions and constants that facilitate debugging.

libfish includes a level-based debugging facility. While your fishnode is running it selects which level of debugging messages to see by calling the fish_setdebuglevel() function. All messages that are at that level or lower numerically will be printed.

Function Documentation

void fish_debug ( int  level,
const char *  format,
  ... 
)

Generate your own debugging message.

  • level The level assigned to your debugging message
  • remaining arguments define the message in printf-style

This function verifies the current debugging level is >= the level assigned to the message before it prints the message. In addition to printing the message this function will also output a timestamp for the message.

void void void fish_debugchar ( int  level,
char  ch 
)

Generates your own debugging message, one character at a time.

  • level The debugging level for the character
  • ch The character to print

The level is one of the constants defined above (or one you define). The message will be printed and the output stream flushed if (level >= fish_getdebuglevel()).

void fish_debugframe ( int  level,
const char *  msg,
const void *  frame,
int  layer,
int  len,
uint8_t  l4_protocol 
)

Print a debugging message plus the contents of a frame.

  • level The debug level for the message
  • msg A c-string containing the message you wish to preceed the frame dump
  • frame A pointer to the frame to dump. The memory isn't changed or freed
  • layer The numerical value (e.g., 2, 3, 4) of the first header on the frame. If the frame is a L3 frame, pass 3 for this parameter.
  • len The length of the frame. This is ignored for L2 frames.
  • l4_protocol The protocol number (e.g., 9 for ARP) for the L4 header. Only necessary when passing an L4 point in via the frame parameter.
void void fish_debugsupp ( int  level,
const char *  format,
  ... 
)

Generate your own debugging messages without the timestamp.

This function is identical to fish_debug(), except it does not automatically add the timestamp to the message.

int fish_getdebuglevel ( void   ) 

gets the current fishnet debugging level.

Returns:
The current debugging level
void fish_setdebugfile ( FILE *  f  ) 

Select the destination for debugging output.

  • f A FILE* to write debugging output to.

Causes all subsequent debugging output to be written to f. Can be called at any point in your program. The default destination for debugging messages is stderr.

void fish_setdebuglevel ( const int  level  ) 

Sets the fishnet debugging level, using the FISH_DEBUG_* constants.

  • level The desired debugging level

Sets the debugging level to the specified value, causing all messages at the same level or numerically lower to be printed. The debug level can be changed anywhere in the program.
